verses.roman:
taveyaṁ viṣamā buddhiḥ
sarva-bhūteṣu durhṛdām
yan manyase sadābhadraṁ
suhṛdāṁ bhadram ajña-vat

synonyms: tava—your; iyam—this; viṣamā—biased; buddhiḥ—attitude; sarva-bhūteṣu—toward all living beings; durhṛdām—of those who have ill intentions; yat—that; manyase—you wish; sadā—always; abhadram—evil; suhṛdām—to your well-wishers; bhadram—good; ajña-vat—like an ignorant person.
translation: [To Rukmiṇī Balarāma said:] Your attitude is unfair, for like an ignorant person you wish good to those who are inimical to all living beings and who have done evil to your true well-wishers.
